alert.note: Alert for Citrus (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 01 at 3:56PM EDT by NWS Tampa Bay
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of central and west central Florida, including the following counties, in central Florida, Sumter. In west central Florida, Citrus, Hernando and Pasco. * WHEN...Until 600 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 356 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Wildwood, Bushnell, Lake Panasoffkee, Center Hill, Webster, Coleman, Sumterville, Wahoo, Adamsville, Tarrytown, Withlapopka Isle, Rutland, Floral City, Oxford and The Green Swamp. - https://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
